Given that you mentioned '2010' and showed interest in a film with a strong political theme, I'd recommend "Invictus" starring Morgan Freeman as Nelson Mandela. In this movie, he attempts to unite South Africa by enlisting the national rugby team to win the 1995 Rugby World Cup. It's an inspiring tale of unity and resilience in the face of adversity.

If you're looking for a thriller, "Shutter Island" with Leonardo DiCaprio is also a great choice. It tells the story of two US marshals investigating the disappearance of a patient on an isolated island, uncovering shocking truths about the place along the way. Both movies offer engaging plots and compelling performances. Enjoy your movie time!
